meanings.definition: The act of removing or taking away something.
meanings.sent1: The remotion of the old furniture made room for the new couch.
meanings.sent2: She carefully completed the remotion of the weeds from the garden.
meanings.sent3: After the remotion of the expired items, the fridge looked much cleaner.
meanings.sent4: The remotion of negativity from her life brought a sense of peace.
meanings.sent5: The remotion of the obstacle allowed for smooth progress.

meanings.definition: The process of moving or changing position.
meanings.sent1: The slow remotion of the turtle caught the children's attention.
meanings.sent2: The remotion of the clouds revealed a clear blue sky.
meanings.sent3: The remotion of the puzzle pieces led to a satisfying solution.
meanings.sent4: The remotion of the train from the station signaled the end of the journey.
meanings.sent5: The remotion of the curtain unveiled a breathtaking view.

meanings.definition: The act of dismissing or getting rid of someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The sudden remotion of the employee surprised the team.
meanings.sent2: The remotion of the old policy brought about positive changes.
meanings.sent3: The remotion of the noisy alarm clock was a relief in the morning.
meanings.sent4: The remotion of the outdated technology paved the way for innovation.
meanings.sent5: The remotion of the graffiti restored the beauty of the building.
